verses.verse: Keep <WH8104> thy foot <WH7272> when thou goest <WH3212> to the house <WH1004> of God <WH430>; for to draw nigh <WH7138> to hear <WH8085> is better than to give <WH5414> the sacrifice <WH2077> of fools <WH3684>: for they know <WH3045> not that they do <WH6213> evil <WH7451>.

Be not rash <WH926> with thy mouth <WH6310>, and let not thy heart <WH3820> be hasty <WH4116> to utter <WH3318> anything <WH1697> before <WH6440> God <WH430>; for God <WH430> is in heaven <WH8064>, and thou upon earth <WH776>: therefore let thy words <WH1697> be few <WH4592>.
For a dream <WH2472> cometh <WH935> with a multitude <WH7230> of business <WH6045>, and a fool <WH3684>'s voice <WH6963> with a multitude <WH7230> of words <WH1697>.
When thou vowest <WH5087> a vow <WH5088> unto God <WH430>, defer <WH309> not to pay <WH7999> it <WH2656>; for he hath no pleasure in fools <WH3684>: pay <WH7999> that which thou vowest <WH5087>.
Better <WH2896> is it that thou shouldest not vow <WH5087>, than that thou shouldest vow <WH5087> and not pay <WH7999>.

Suffer <WH5414> not thy mouth <WH6310> to cause thy flesh <WH1320> to sin <WH2398>; neither say <WH559> thou before <WH6440> the angel <WH4397>, that it was an error <WH7684>: wherefore should God <WH430> be angry <WH7107> at thy voice <WH6963>, and destroy <WH2254> the work <WH4639> of thy hands <WH3027>?
For in the multitude <WH7230> of dreams <WH2472> there are vanities <WH1892>, and in many <WH7235> words <WH1697>: but fear <WH3372> thou God <WH430>.

If thou seest <WH7200> the oppression <WH6233> of the poor <WH7326>, and the violent <WH1499> taking away of justice <WH6664> and righteousness <WH4941> in a province <WH4082>, marvel <WH8539> not at the matter <WH2656>: for one higher <WH1364> than the high <WH1364> regardeth <WH8104>; and there are higher <WH1364> than they <WH5921>.
Moreover the profit <WH3504> of the earth <WH776> is for all <WH4428>: the king himself is served <WH5647> by the field <WH7704>.
He that loveth <WH157> silver <WH3701> shall not be satisfied <WH7646> with silver <WH3701>; nor he that loveth <WH157> abundance <WH1995>, with increase <WH8393>: this also is vanity <WH1892>.

When goods <WH2896> increase <WH7235>, they are increased <WH7231> that eat <WH398> them <WH3788>; and what advantage is there to the owner <WH1167> thereof <WH518>, save the beholding <WH7207> of them with his eyes <WH5869>?

The sleep <WH8142> of a laboring man <WH5647> is sweet <WH4966>, whether he eat <WH398> little <WH4592> or much <WH7235>; but the fulness <WH7647> of the rich <WH6223> will not suffer <WH3240> him to sleep <WH3462>.
There is <WH3426> a grievous <WH2470> evil <WH7451> which I have seen <WH7200> under the sun <WH8121>, namely <WH6239>, riches kept <WH8104> by the owner <WH1167> thereof to his hurt <WH7451>:
and those riches <WH6239> perish <WH6> by evil <WH7451> adventure <WH6045>; and if he hath begotten <WH3205> a son <WH1121>, there is nothing <WH3972> in his hand <WH3027>.

As he came forth <WH3318> from his mother <WH517>'s womb <WH990>, naked <WH6174> shall he go <WH3212> again <WH7725> as he came <WH935>, and shall take <WH5375> nothing <WH3972> for his labor <WH5999>, which he may carry away <WH3212> in his hand <WH3027>.

And this <WH2090> also is a grievous <WH2470> evil <WH7451>, that in all points <WH5980> as he came <WH935>, so shall he go <WH3212>: and what profit <WH3504> hath he that he laboreth <WH5998> for the wind <WH7307>?
All his days <WH3117> also he eateth <WH398> in darkness <WH2822>, and he is sore <WH7235> vexed <WH3707>, and hath sickness <WH2483> and wrath <WH7110>.

Behold <WH7200>, that which I have seen to be good <WH2896> and to be comely <WH3303> is for one to eat <WH398> and to drink <WH8354>, and to enjoy <WH7200> good <WH2896> in all his labor <WH5999>, wherein he laboreth <WH5998> under the sun <WH8121>, all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of his life <WH2416> which God <WH430> hath given <WH5414> him <WH2506>: for this is his portion.

Every man <WH120> also to whom God <WH430> hath given <WH5414> riches <WH6239> and wealth <WH5233>, and hath given him power <WH7980> to eat <WH398> thereof <WH5375>, and to take his portion <WH2506>, and to rejoice <WH8055> in his labor <WH5999> â€” this <WH2090> is the gift <WH4991> of God <WH430>.
For he shall not much <WH7235> remember <WH2142> the days <WH3117> of his life <WH2416>; because God <WH430> answereth <WH6031> him in the joy <WH8057> of his heart <WH3820>.
